nitf
Class IOHandle

java.lang.Object
  nitf.NITFObject
      nitf.IOHandle

public final class IOHandle
extends NITFObject

A representation of a handle to a file object.

This class provides access to a native file object, so it does not use the Java io library.

Field Summary
static int NITF_ACCESS_READONLY
          Opens the file with read-only privileges
static int NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE
          Opens the file for reading and/or writing
static int NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY
          Opens the file with write-only privileges

          Opens an existing file
static int NITF_TRUNCATE
          Truncates the file
static int SEEK_CUR
          Seek offset is relative to current position
static int SEEK_END
          Seek offset is relative to end of file
static int SEEK_SET
          Seek offset is relative to start of file

Constructor Detail

IOHandle

public IOHandle(java.lang.String fileName)
         throws NITFException
Creates a new IOHandle object for READING, using the file referenced from a parent pathname string; This sets the access flag to NITF_ACCESS_READONLY and the creation flag to NITF_OPEN_EXISTING

Parameters:
fileName - the path of the file associated with this handle
Throws:
NITFException

IOHandle

public IOHandle(java.lang.String fileName,
                int accessFlag,
                int creationFlag)
         throws NITFException
Creates a new IOHandle object, using the file referenced from a parent pathname string and an access modifier.

Parameters:
fileName - the path of the file associated with this handle
accessFlag - options are NITF_ACCESS_READONLY, NITF_ACCESS_WRITEONLY, or NITF_ACCESS_READWRITE
creationFlag - options are NITF_CREATE, NITF_TRUNCATE, or NITF_OPEN_EXISTING
Throws:
NITFException
Method Detail

read

public void read(byte[] buf,
                 int size)
          throws NITFException
Reads size bytes into the specified byte buffer

Parameters:
buf - the byte buffer to store the data
size - the amount to read
Throws:
NITFException

write

public void write(byte[] buf,
                  int size)
           throws NITFException
Writes size bytes to the file at the current position

Parameters:
buf - the byte buffer containing the data
size - the amount to write
Throws:
NITFException

seek

public long seek(long offset,
                 int whence)
          throws NITFException
Seeks to the specified offset relative to the position specified by whence

Parameters:
offset - the offset in the file
whence - the type of seek, either SEEK_CUR, SEEK_SET, or SEEK_END
Returns:
the position in the file after the seek
Throws:
NITFException

close

public void close()
Closes the file descriptor. Good implementation should always end by calling this.
